title: league turns my pc into a hotbox and destroys my wireless connection
body:
Ever since I've been playing league I have always experienced insanely high GPU and CPU temperatures that are literally around 50 degrees celcius  and to put into simpler terms my pc feels like im hovering my hand over a camp fire. I have never had this problem with any other game and I can play games like Fallout 4 and csgo smoothly and what makes the league experience even worse is that usually with high temperatures comes insanely high ping that destroys my connection, upwards of 500+, but in csgo i can easily get ~50 ping all day every day, and even if it couldn't get any worse the ping makes the game unplayable and i have left so many matches because of this dilemma.

my (bad) specs 
gpu - gtx 560 ti
cpu - amd fx 4130 quad core 
8 gb of ram  

is there any simple fix i'm not finding or is it just time for a new pc?

replies.body: Generally, lag spikes like this could be due to network issues like packet loss.  You can run a [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader) to get an overview of what's going wrong in these matches.  The results will also offer some troubleshooting steps specific to your issue.  I am more concerned about this hotbox problem though; it sounds like a messy situation that should get looked into so your hardware doesn't die out.  For this, we have a section on[ detecting heat build-up](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting#wq7).  Hope all that helps!
